;在下个月的金砖国家峰会之前，南非处于紧张的外交处境，这将是为俄罗斯总统弗拉基米尔·普京提供了一个难得的舞台，可以与莫斯科一些最亲密的伙伴会面——如果他亲自出席的话。

;

;该国已向所有出席活动的领导人授予外交豁免权，因此普京也许能够避免被捕如果他确实前往约翰内斯堡参加 8 月 22 日至 24 日的峰会。南非是国际刑事法院的签署国，该法院于 3 月份因涉嫌在乌克兰犯下战争罪而对普京发出了逮捕令。

;

;南非是今年由主要新兴经济体组成的金砖国家集团的主席国，还包括巴西、俄罗斯、印度和中国。

;

;总统西里尔·拉马福萨周日表示，峰会不会以虚拟形式举行，但并未确认已受邀参加此次活动的普京是否会亲自出席。<据报道，比勒陀利亚正计划尝试将峰会移至中国，但中国不是国际刑事法院创始文件《罗马规约》的签署国。但中国国家主席习近平上个月在与拉马福萨通电话时表示，“中方支持南非作为轮值主席国，成功举办今年金砖国家的各项合作活动”。

;

;南非——像中国一样– 拒绝谴责俄罗斯入侵乌克兰，但呼吁进行对话。

;

;中国希望有新的金砖国家成员，但印度、巴西担心“失去影响力”

;

;将峰会移至华盛顿国防大学非洲战略研究中心研究员保罗·南图亚 (Paul Nantulya) 表示，现阶段中国将“在后勤方面非常具有挑战性”。

;

;南图亚表示，南非的另一个选择是继续前进与峰会讨论并稍后处理后果。他说，执政的非洲人国民大会的一些高级成员赞成这种做法，以避免比勒陀利亚看起来像是屈服于西方压力。

;

;“这对拉马福萨来说无异于自杀，他正在拼命试图摆脱困境。”在明年竞争激烈的选举之前，我们将获得党内各方面的支持。”Nantulya 说。

;

;中国可能会向南非提供政治、经济和外交支持，他说

;

;“如果峰会在南非举行，中国将派出一支高素质团队——可能是习近平本人——为非洲人国民大会提供外交掩护，如果美国退出，中国甚至可能提供优惠的市场准入”Nantulya 说。

;

;但在上个月瓦格纳集团试图在俄罗斯发动叛乱之后，普京比他更不愿意出国旅行。南非国际事务研究所非洲-俄罗斯项目负责人史蒂文·格鲁兹德表示，以前是这样。

;

;他表示，如果普京真的前往南非，他似乎也不太可能被拘留非洲。

;

;格鲁兹德表示，这可能会重演 2015 年的情况，当时同样受到国际刑事法院起诉的苏丹总统奥马尔·巴希尔 (Omar al-Bashir) 出席在南非举行的非洲联盟峰会，尽管有紧急情况，但仍被允许离开法院下令逮捕他。

;

;“南非不想被贴上流氓国家的标签，国际社会对普京问题的关注要多得多，”格鲁兹德说。

;

;金砖国家在推动扩大集团的过程中会见寻求更密切联系的“朋友”

;

;斯泰伦博斯大学非洲治理与领导力安全研究所的研究协调员弗朗索瓦·弗雷建议，中国可以通过以下方式向南非表示声援：为金砖国家会议提供资金，以减轻任何反弹。

;

;“南非是金砖国家中规模最小的参与者，在获得更大团结和成员资格的第一个机会就在此时，南非不想破坏金砖国家的团结。” ”Vrey 说。

;

;但他指出，比勒陀利亚的“经济利益很大程度上与西方和中国挂钩”，因此它必须决定如何处理这一困境。弗雷说：“如果一切都转向中国，南非就摆脱了困境。”

;

;普京出席峰会对南非来说最终是一项挑战，在南非的人权遗产与西方关系之间造成了紧张关系。马萨诸塞州塔夫茨大学助理教授米哈埃拉·帕帕 (Mihaela Papa) 表示，一方面是金砖国家的野心，另一方面是金砖国家的野心。

;

;帕帕表示，中国的支持不会有太大帮助。她说：“中国在这里的参与不会让南非能够定义自己的全球角色和领导地位，也不会有助于中国对乌克兰的外交政策。”

;以色列总理本杰明·内塔尼亚胡周日下令驱逐利库德集团的一名活动人士他嘲笑大屠杀，同时质问反政府抗议者，其言论暗示了宪法危机之下的种族紧张局势。

;

;社交媒体上流传的视频显示，伊齐克·扎卡在工作场所附近的一个交通路口向示威者咒骂并向示威者吐口水。周六，贝特谢安 (Beit Shean) 小镇。

;

;“六百万人被杀并非无缘无故，”他喊道。 “我为你们六百万人被烧死而感到自豪！”

;

;“我们不会容忍利库德集团运动中的这种可耻行为，”内塔尼亚胡在一份关于扎卡下台的声明中说道。以色列总理内塔尼亚胡被送往医院，病情稳定;

;通过将纳粹种族灭绝中的大多数欧洲犹太人受害者视为对手，扎尔卡似乎在区分他们内塔尼亚胡的宗教民族主义联盟的一些成员将总理推动司法机构改革的努力视为纠正精英主义的过度扩张。主导以色列建国一代的阿什肯纳兹（Askenazi）或欧洲后裔犹太人。

;

;米兹拉希姆（Mizrahim）约占以色列犹太人多数人口的一半（由于与德系犹太人通婚，这一数字很难确定）。次抱怨歧视和社会经济劣势。

;

;根据以色列法律，否认大屠杀、质疑其规模或庆祝大屠杀将被判处五年监禁。历史灾难是一个普遍团结犹太人的问题，扎尔卡的言论受到了各个政治派别的谴责。

;

;身为犹太人的扎尔卡在社交媒体上流传的一份声明中表示，他的言论已“被删除” ”，并将自己描述为大屠杀幸存者的孙子。

;

;拟议司法改革的批评者认为，内塔尼亚胡试图限制法院的独立性，尽管他在长期的腐败审判中坚称自己无罪。这位资深总理表示，改革将平衡政府部门。

;

;一些反政府示威者将其与 20 世纪 30 年代德国走向暴政的行进进行了比较，这促使利库德集团议员、以色列信息部长加利特·迪斯塔尔·阿特巴扬 (Galit Distal Atbaryan) 表示，指责他们轻视大屠杀。

;

;“在那里被烧死的是你们的家人”，具有波斯犹太血统的迪斯塔尔·阿特巴扬 (Distal Atbaryan) 三月份在议会对反对派政客说道。 “这怎么可能？”

;香港将为其强制性养老金计划引入一站式数码平台将于 2024 年，即原定推出日期两年后。

;

;强制性公积金计划管理局主席刘麦花臣周日还誓言将继续推进计划，以便在 2025 年之前使该系统全面投入运行。

;< p>;“不仅强积金管理效率将显着提高，计划成员还将享受费用减免……这将进一步加强计划成员的退休保障。”她说。

;

;

;香港养老基金利润达 322 亿港元，为会员带来丰厚利润< /h3>;

;

;强积金电子平台由时任行政长官梁振英于2017年提出，目的是通过精简计划管理来削减成本并提高基金管理的透明度。

;

;

;刘周日承诺，当局将继续努力实现其目标确保该平台于 2025 年全面投入运作。

;

;

;

;

;

;海关官员周日表示，他们发现了 82 公斤（181 磅）的毒品（称为冰毒或冰毒）。周二在机场检查了来自加拿大的机器。

;

;

;“贩毒集团在这些重型毒品内藏有大量冰毒。空气压缩机并将其与普通压缩机混合。他们还用大木箱来搬运。”海关缉毒局机场调查大队队长陈梦迪说。 “这一切都是为了欺骗海关，让他们认为他们运送的是合法货物。”

;

;

;海关官员表示，根据风险评估，这批机场货物被挑选出来进行额外检查，仔细检查货物后发现了怀疑。

;

;他们说，两台压缩机的外部都发现了焊接痕迹，而且货物中包含的配件也不兼容。

;

;官员们后来发现，这些机器在用重物切开后发现含有冰毒。 -执勤设备。

;

;官员在其中一台机器中发现了剩余的货物。

;

;

;

;今年截至5月检获的前三名毒品为可卡因、冰毒和大麻。

;2023 年对于登山者来说是特别致命的一年，珠穆朗玛峰已经出现了这是有记录以来死亡人数最多的一年。

;

;据报道，到春季结束时，已有 13 人在山上死亡，另有 4 人失踪，一位经验丰富的登山者将责任归咎于不断上升的登山人数。据《泰晤士报》报道，尼泊尔登山公司的数量。

;

;英国登山者肯顿·库尔 (Kenton Cool) 保持着尼泊尔以外出生的人攀登珠穆朗玛峰次数最多的记录，他表示，其中一些经营者将利润置于安全之上

;

;“当我 2004 年到达现场时，大多数登山者都有深厚的攀岩经历，”他告诉《泰晤士报》。

;

; p>;

;“现在有成群结队的人以前没有爬过山。这就是我们造成多人死亡的原因之一。缺乏经验，缺乏支持。”他补充道。

;

;Cool，49 岁，拥有 17 次登顶珠穆朗玛峰的记录，他注意到公司数量接连出现和消失，他说这突显了西方国家不太可能发现的问责制的缺失。

;

;他呼吁对如何提高标准进行调查。

;

;马来西亚登山者因不感谢夏尔巴人而受到猛烈抨击”他说，这个季节的“天气条件不太好，变化很大”，并补充说“气候变化对山区产生了很大影响”。

;

;但库尔表示，他听说了一个令人担忧的案例操作员没有携带足够的氧气瓶供所有客户到达山顶。

;

;“如果您有 10 个客户，而您只能为其中 5 个提供氧气，如果所有 10 个客户都需要氧气， 那你怎么办呢？会不会发生氧气被盗的情况？这不是一个监管良好的行业。对于西方服装来说，这种情况绝对不会发生。不知道客户在哪里——这是怎么发生的？” Cool 说。

;

;其他徒步旅行者将死亡归咎于山上过度拥挤，自 1900 年代初首次开始探险以来，已有 300 多人死亡。

;

;一些人抱怨人类的行为登山者在到达海拔 8,000 米（约 26,250 英尺）以上时就会进入“死亡区”，那里交通拥堵。那里的空气稀薄到危险的程度，大多数人必须使用氧气面罩来保证安全。

;

;“珠穆朗玛峰周围似乎有一种灾难神秘感，这似乎只会增强这个地方的吸引力，”电影制片人和《夏尔巴人》的导演詹妮弗·皮多姆 (Jennifer Peedom) 此前曾表示。

;

;“现在非常拥挤，而且每年都在变得越来越拥挤，”她补充道。

;尹锡烈总统于周日结束了对三个中欧国家的访问。他表明首尔与北约和乌克兰的关系更加牢固。

;

;尹先生本周出席了北约成员国及其印度-太平洋伙伴国家峰会，强调印度-太平洋和大西洋地区的安全是密不可分的，并声称朝鲜的核和导弹野心也是对欧洲国家的威胁。

;

;It was more than 20 years ago, towards the end of 2000, that Kan Kan last saw his older brother, the suspected terrorist Encep Nurjaman better known by his alias Hambali.

;

;“He came to visit me and our family in Cianjur. Then the Christmas Eve bombings happened. I didn't think that he had been involved, but then I saw it in the news and everyone was saying that he had been the mastermind,” Kan Kan said.

;

;The blasts, which had been timed to coincide with Christmas Eve mass at churches across Indonesia, killed 18 and left 118 people injured.

;

;While Kan Kan and his family were devastated by the accusation that Hambali had been behind the attacks, more bad news was to come. Just two years later, in October 2002, another series of bombs ripped through Kuta in Bali, killing 202 people and injuring some 200 others. In 2003, Hambali was arrested in Thailand, suspected of masterminding the Bali blasts, and handed over to US authorities.

;

;From there, he was sent to CIA black sites where he was allegedly tortured, before being transferred to the Guantanamo Bay Detention Camp, where he remains awaiting trial.

;

;“I never asked him about his involvement in the Christmas Eve bombings or the Bali bombing. I couldn't, and he wouldn't have been able to answer anyway,” Kan Kan told This Week in Asia.

;

;“In my heart, I always wanted to know.”

;

;Hambali has long been suspected of being a senior member of the Indonesian hardline Islamic group Jemaah Islamiah, although charges were only formally laid in 2021 related to the Bali bombing, and the 2003 attack on the JW Marriott Hotel in Indonesia's capital, Jakarta, in which 12 people were killed.

;

;The Bali blast case is still going through pre-trial motions. Hambali will stand trial with two co-accused, Malaysian nationals and his alleged accomplices Mohammed Nazir bin Lep and Mohammed Farik bin Amin.

;

;Yet justice continues to move slowly for the three men, as the pre-trial motions meant to resume from July 24 to August 4 were suddenly cancelled by the chief of the Guantanamo judiciary, Army Colonel Lanny J. Acosta Jr., on July 12.

;

;“This is a system designed to fail and designed to prevent just outcomes,” Hambali's lawyer, James Hodes, told This Week in Asia regarding the cancellations.

;

;“The military lawyers and judges must rotate out every two to three years to continue their career advancement. If any of them want to stay longer they are forced out by people of higher rank and so the system fails.”

;

;When Hambali was first sent to Guantanamo, his family was not able to communicate with him, Kan Kan said, but over the years, restrictions have been relaxed. In the early years, Hambali and his family were able to send letters back and forth, before being allowed voice calls and finally video calls.

;

;One-hour Skype calls with Hambali and his family are now facilitated every three months by the International Committee of the Red Cross at their offices in Jakarta.

;

;According to Kan Kan, the conversations, in Bahasa Indonesia, can be laborious. They first need to be translated by a Guantanamo interpreter who is listening to make sure Hambali and his family are not discussing anything inappropriate. There is also a long list of things that cannot be discussed, including anything to do with his case.

;

;According to Kan Kan, requests to meet his older brother in person have been ignored.

;

;In June, UN human rights investigator Fionnuala Ní Aoláin was granted unprecedented access to the facility and produced a scathing report in which she stated that the 30 men still incarcerated there have been subject to “cruel, inhuman and degrading treatment”.

;

;The report said that the prisoners were waterboarded, deprived of food, water, and sleep, in addition to being kicked, thrown to the ground, violently slapped and shaken, and held in solitary confinement for months. The report also said prisoners were told that multiple serious harms would befall their family members including physical violence, economic distress and social shaming.

;

;The report went on to say that detainees were also subjected to sexual violence, including anal penetration, and the US government authorised and justified the acts, and personnel enabled and sustained the torture of detainees.

;

;Sidney Jones, senior adviser to the Institute for Policy Analysis of Conflict, described Guantanamo as a “blot on the supposed American commitment to the rule of law”.

;

;“Guantanamo as an institution is a disgrace, and the fact that Hambali has been in custody for 20 years without trial is shameful,” she told This Week in Asia from New York.

;

;For now, as for the past 20 years, Hambali's family can only wait and pray that there will be a resolution to his case soon.

;

;“We are just resigned to the situation at this point,” Kan Kan said. “They should either charge him and let him serve his sentence and then deport him, or let him go.”

;

;Kan Kan said if he could say anything to his older brother, who he has now not seen in person for more than 20 years, he would only need eight words.

;

;“I hope we can meet again one day.”

;China's southern tech hub of Shenzhen is building what could be the world's largest indoor ski resort.

;

;Spread over more than 10 hectares (24 acres), Shenzhen's Ice and Snow World resort will feature winter sports facilities across 8 hectares – “an area equal to 11 football pitches” – the Shenzhen city government said on its official WeChat account.

;

;China is already home to some of the world's biggest indoor ski facilities, including record holder Wanda Snow Park in northern Heilongjiang province, which covers an area equal to about nine football pitches.

;

;State-owned Zhuhai Huafa Group has invested over 29.6 billion yuan (US$4.15 billion) in the Shenzhen project, which is expected to be ready by November 2025.

;

;Located next to the Shenzhen World Convention and Exhibition Centre, the resort is expected to attract tourists from around the world, and compete with other mega theme parks such as Shanghai Disneyland and Universal Studios in Beijing, the Shenzhen government statement said.

;

;State of the art facilities at the Shenzhen snow park will include a ski drop of about 83m (272 feet) and a 441m single ski track, both records for China.

;

;The complex – shaped like a blue whale leaping out of the water – will also include themed hotels and shopping centres to draw tourists.

;

;“With the theme of ice and snow as the core feature, we expect to create an efficient and complex cultural tourism complex,” Hu Qi, an official in charge of design at Zhuhai Huafa, told the Communist Party's mouthpiece People's Daily.

;

;The paper also spoke to Huang Yuanchao, deputy general manager of Huafa's Shenzhen branch, who said: “After the project opens in 2025, it is expected that the annual influx of tourists will reach one million. It will host international competitions and promote skiing for all. At the same time, it will also help to boost development around the area.”

;

;A statement from Huafa said snow quality at the resort would meet the standards for hosting international skiing competitions, and future plans might include starting a youth winter games training camp.

;

;Shenzhen has two smaller indoor skiing resorts – a 0.43 hectare facility at the Window of the World theme park and a 0.54 hectare complex named Karoo Ice Snow, which opened in April.
